snippet: Forecasts of flooding from Tropical Storm Hermine and a declaration of a state of emergency drove away vacationers and left merchants with sharply lower revenue this Labor Day weekend....
abstract: Forecasts of severe weather from Tropical Storm Hermine, along with declaration of state of emergency for three counties along New Jersey's shore, caused mass exodus of Labor Day tourists from barrier island on which beachfront city of Wildwood sits; merchants there report sharply lower revenue over what would normally be one of busiest weekends of year, and many blame Gov Chris Christie, along with city officials, saying excessive caution drove customers away.
lead_paragraph: Forecasts of flooding from Tropical Storm Hermine and a declaration of a state of emergency drove away vacationers and left merchants with sharply lower revenue this Labor Day weekend.

headline.main: Jersey Shore Shopkeepers Are Hit by a Storm That Never Arrived
headline.print_headline: New Jersey Merchants Hit by the Storm That Wasn’t
